subject: Art & Design
title: Split-Complementary: Contrast Without Clash
description: A 60-second lesson on Split-Complementary: Contrast Without Clash.

hook.text: You love the energy of complements but want less visual tension. There's a scheme for that.

buildup.text: Instead of the direct opposite, pick the two colors flanking it. That's split-complementary.

discovery.text: You get strong contrast like complements, but the slight angle softens the clash.

twist.text: It's one of the hardest schemes to mess up â€” almost any split-comp combo looks decent.

climax.text: Web designers favor it because it provides visual interest without overwhelming the user.

punchline.text: Shift the complement a few degrees. Instant sophistication.

quiz.question: How does split-complementary differ from complementary?
options: It uses the two colors flanking the complement instead of the direct opposite
